alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 17 at 11:50AM CDT until May 17 at 2:45PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: The National Weather Service in Omaha/Valley has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Wayne County in northeastern Nebraska... * Until 245 PM CDT. * At 1150 AM CDT, trained weather spotters reported significant runoff out of fields and ditches flowing over county roads. This runoff is likely to cause flash flooding of creeks and streams shortly. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported significant runoff out of fields and ditches flowing over county roads. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Winside and Hoskins. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
